content: Quantum Physics and Logic 2020 is taking place June 2-6 online, and if you want to tune in you have to register here.

Here are the talks:

Matthew Amy, Andrew N. Glaudell and Neil J. Ross. Number-Theoretic Characterizations of Some Restricted Clifford+T Circuits

Ana Belén Sainz, Matthew Hoban, Paul Skrzypczyk and Leandro Aolita. Bipartite post-quantum steering in generalised scenarios

David Schmid, Denis Rosset and Francesco Buscemi. Quantifying Bell nonclassicality across arbitrary resource types

Thomas Galley and Lluis Masanes. How dynamics constrains probabilities in general probabilistic theories

Bob Coecke and Konstantinos Meichanetzidis. Meaning updating of density matrices

Andre Kornell, Bert Lindenhovius and Michael Mislove. Quantum CPOs

Kenta Cho, Bas Westerbaan and John van de Wetering. Dichotomy between deterministic and probabilistic models in countably additive effectus theory

Niel de Beaudrap. Well-tempered ZX and ZH calculi

Hector Miller-Bakewell, Miriam Backens, Giovanni de Felice, John van de Wetering and Leo Lobski. There and back again: A circuit extraction tale

Samson Abramsky and Rui Soares Barbosa. Partial boolean algebras and the logical exclusivity principle

Quanlong Wang. An algebraic axiomatisation of ZX-calculus

Anthony Munson, Bob Coecke and Quanlong Wang. AND-gates in ZX-calculus: spider nest identities and QBC-completeness

Andre Kornell. Quantum predicate logic with equality

Laurent Poinsot. Hilbertian Frobenius algebras (Extended Abstract)

Adriana Correia, Henk Stoof and Michael Moortgat. Putting a Spin on Language: A Quantum Interpretation of Unary Connectives for Linguistic Applications

Masanao Ozawa. Quantum Set Theories Satisfying Both the Transfer Principle and De Morgan's Laws

Nikola Andrejić and Ravi Kunjwal. Joint measurability structures realizable with qubit measurements: incompatibility via marginal surgery

Farid Shahandeh. Contextuality of general probabilistic theories

Robert Booth and Damian Markham. Flow Conditions for Continuous Variable Measurement-based Quantum Computing

Matthew Wilson and Giulio Chiribella. A Diagrammatic Approach to Information Transmission in Generalised Switches

Arianne Meijer - van de Griend and Ross Duncan. Architecture-aware synthesis of phase polynomials for NISQ devices

Hlér Kristjánsson, Sina Salek, Daniel Ebler, Matthew Wilson and Giulio Chiribella. Resource theories of communication with quantum superpositions of processes

Konstantinos Meichanetzidis, Aleks Kissinger and Niel de Beaudrap. Tensor Network Rewriting Strategies for Satisfiability and Counting

Sebastian Horvat and Borivoje Dakić. Interference as an information-theoretic game

Sanjaye Ramgoolam, Mehrnoosh Sadrzadeh and Lewis Sword. Gaussianity and typicality in matrix distributional semantics

Cole Comfort. The ZX& calculus: A complete graphical calculus for classical circuits using spiders

Konstantinos Meichanetzidis, Stefano Gogioso, Nicolò Chiappori, Giovanni De Felice, Alexis Toumi and Bob Coecke. QNLP on Near-Term Quantum Computers

Nicola Pinzani and Stefano Gogioso. Giving Operational Meaning to the Superposition of Causal Orders

Louis Lemonnier, Aleks Kissinger and John van de Wetering. Hypergraph simplification: Linking the path-sum approach to the ZH-calculus

James Hefford and Stefano Gogioso. Hyper-decoherence in Density Hypercubes

Jan Paseka and Thomas Vetterlein. Hilbert spaces reduced to their orthogonality relation

Mehdi Mhalla and Sacha Huriot. Contextuality and Expressivity of Non-locality

Titouan Carette, Simon Perdrix and Dominic Horsman. SZX-calculus: Scalable Graphical Quantum Reasoning

Shiv Akshar Yadavalli and Ravi Kunjwal. Contextual advantage for noisy one-shot classical communication assisted by entanglement

Pierre-Emmanuel Emeriau, Mark Howard and Shane Mansfield. The Torpedo Game: Quantum Advantage, Wigner Negativity, and Sequential Contextuality in a Generalised Random Access Code

Lorenzo Catani and Matthew Leifer. A mathematical framework for operational fine tunings

Robert Rand, Aarthi Sundaram, Kartik Singhal and Brad Lackey. Gottesman Types for Quantum Programs

Kartik Singhal and John Reppy. Quantum Hoare Type Theory

V. Vilasini, Lídia Del Rio and Renato Renner. Causality in definite and indefinite space-times

Ämin Baumeler and Eleftherios Tselentis. Equivalence of grandfather and information antinomy under intervention

Timothée Hoffreumon and Ognyan Oreshkov. The multi-round process matrix

Michal Sedlak and Mario Ziman. Perfect probabilistic storage and retrieval of phase gates
